name: nuclear power plant construction, boiling water reactor 1000MW | nuclear power plant, boiling water reactor 1000MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7220/documentation

Estimation based on data of the power plant in Leibstadt with a net installed capacity of 1080 MW (year 1999). Before construction of the plant, the terrain had to be levelized, which required huge digging, a factor of ten compared to the average for a 1000 MW unit; this is not accounted here in order to have a generic module. Material and energy data for construction were available from the operators at the beginning of the 1990s. Waste material inventory data from decommissioning were extrapolated from the figures for the PWR in GÃ¶sgen, which are used for the module "nuclear power plant, pressure water reactor", CH.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



The module includes materials, energy and transport requirements used for construction of the plant. Land-use is included with the assumption of 40 years operation. Disposal of non-contaminated material from dismantling is also included, whereas contaminated materials are attributed to the operation.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Swiss data of one specific plant.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The described plant Leibstadt started commercial operation at the end of 1984. It belongs to the 1000 MW class (net installed capacity has been upgraded in steps from the original 990 MW to 1165 MW at the end of 1999). It has a GE designed primary circuit, a Mark III containment, and a cooling tower. This module can be assumed to be representative for other boiling water reactors of the same class in Western Europe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: none This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
Total electricity consumed during construction phase is 3.1E+08 kWh. From this, 2.98E+08 kWh is used for construction, and the rest is used for the test group run, which is considered in the input of light fuel oil (heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas). For the demolition, 75% of the total electricity consumed during construction is assumed. Therefore, electricity consumed is 2.98E+08 + 3.1E+08*75%. Source: v2 Report 6 part VII, p. 179 & 198).
EcoSpold01Location=CH

exchanges.description:
Diesel used for construction and demolition. Around 6 million kg of diesel are used for construction of the plant. The energy demand for the demolition of a light-water nuclear power plant of the 1000 MW class is 75% of the amount of energy used for the construction of the NPP. Therefore, 6*10^6*(1 + 0.75) kg diesel. Source: ecoinvent v2 Report 6, part VII, p. 198).
The LHV of diesel is 42.8 MJ/kg (ecoinvent MasterData, accessed on 20230728).
<The construction diesel consumption was added in 20230728; before only the demolition part was taken into account>
EcoSpold01Location=GLO

flow.category: F:Construction/43:Specialized construction activities/431:Demolition and site preparation/4312:Site preparation

exchanges.description:
Total electricity consumed during construction phase is 3.1E+08 kWh. From this, 2.98E+08 kWh is used for construction, and the rest is used for the test group run, which is considered in the input of light fuel oil (heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas). For the demolition, 75% of the total electricity consumed during construction is assumed. Therefore, electricity consumed is 2.98E+08 + 3.1E+08*75%. Source: v2 Report 6 part VII, p. 179 & 198).

For the demolition, 75% of the total electricity consumed during construction is assumed. Therefore, electricity consumed is 2.98E+08 + 3.1E+08*75%. Source: v2 Report 6 part VII, p. 179 & 198).
EcoSpold01Location=CH
